topic.title: Installation
topic.shortdesc: Couchbase Server Developer Preview 4.5 is installed for development purposes only on Linux, Mas OSX, and Windows.

body.p: To install Couchbase Server for this Developer Preview follow the instructions in the Installation guide for Couchbase Server 4.1.

section.title: Supported platforms
section.p: Couchbase Server 4.5 version adds support for Debian 8 platform.
This version is certified to run on a number of popular platforms and virtual environments for development and testing purposes only.
The 4.5 Developer Preview version is also hosted on Docker.

section.title: Upgrade
section.p: Couchbase Server 4.5 Developer Preview (DP) is an early developer milestone update and requires a fresh install. Upgrading from an earlier version of Couchbase Server is not supported.

body.section:
Sizing guidelinesSee Sizing Guidelines for Clouchbase Server 4.1 for general information.
The additional sizing guidelines for Couchbase Server 4.5 Developer Preview are provided to ensure that you have enough hardware resources to support all new functionality.
There are three hardware resources you need to consider when sizing a Couchbase Server node:
Hardware resources for Couchbase Server Developer Preview 4.5
Resource Minimum Recommended
CPU 4 8 and above. Both the number and performance of CPUs are important.
RAM 4GB 16GB and above. More RAM means that more data can be served from memory and allow for better performance.
Disk 8GB 16GB and above
RAM This resource represents the main memory allocated to Couchbase Server and should be determined by the following factors:
How much free RAM is available beyond OS and other applications.
How much data do you want to store in main memory.
How much latency you expect from KV/indexing/query performance.
The new components that require RAM are:
Memory optimized global indexes, which enable in-memory index processing and index scans with the lowest latency.
Full Text Search (FTS), where the Minimum RAM allocation is 512MB, and recommended is 2048MB+ RAM.
Minimum RAM quota for Couchbase Server components
Component Minimum RAM
Data Service 1GB
Indexing Service powered by ForestDB 256MB
Indexing Service powered by Memory-Optimized Index 256MB minimum, 1GB recommended.
Full text search 512MB
Disk Requirements for your disk subsystem are:
Disk size, which refers to the amount of the disk storage space needed to hold your entire data set.
Disk I/O, which is a combination of your sustained read/write rate, the need for compacting the database files, and anything else that requires disk access.
To better support your Couchbase Server, keep in mind the following:
Disk space continues to grow if fragmentation ratio keeps climbing. To mitigate that, add enough buffer in your disk space to store all the data. Also, keep an eye on the fragmentation ratio in the UI and trigger compaction process when needed.
SSD is desired but not required. SSD will bring much better performance than HDD regarding disk throughput and latency.

section.title: Enabling the new storage option for Global Indexes
section.p: Storage option for global indexes is set with the configuration of the first node that runs index service. At the time of setup, users can either use the existing global index storage or can utilize the new memory-optimized global index storage for faster index processing.

The storage option for global indexes cannot be changed after setting up the first node that runs the index service. To change the storage setting, remove all nodes running index service first using remove node operation. If you are running a single node, uninstall and reinstall Couchbase Server with the new option.

body.section:
Enabling the new Full Text ServiceYou can enable or disable the Full Text service on the initial Configure Server screen. Select or clear the Full Text check box in the Services section.
If the Full Text service is enabled, then you also have to set its RAM quota on the same screen.
